channel.title: Server Setup (Please help!)
channel.description: Whenever I try to run compile.bat it says [i]'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file.[/i] I did the My computer thing to make it recognize Java and i've read many guides. Then I noticed I had to download JDK. I went to [url=http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp]http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp[/url]. I have no idea which one to download. Can I please have some help, I really want to get my server up and running today. :confused:

item.title: Server Setup (Please help!)
item.dc:creator: @Vaqide Vaqide
item.description:
@Vaqide wrote:

Grr. I CAN’T DOWNLOAD JDK BECAUSE IT WON’T EVEN DOWNLOAD IT KEEPS GETTING THE DOWNLOAD ERROR. I did the thing to recongnize it, but now I can’t even get JDK installed or even download. Please help

Read full topic

item.title: Server Setup (Please help!)
item.dc:creator: @outrageouscape outrageouscape
item.description:
@outrageouscape wrote:

i change some of my stuff round and found out its not jdk its jre1.6.0_02 and i changed i on my compiler and italmost works perfect heres mycome compiler code [code]@echo off
cls
title outrageouscape’s offical compiler v2.0
:main
echo ------------------------------------------------------
echo Welcome to outrageouscape’s offical Compiler V2.0
echo This Compiler is for Java 1.6.0_02
echo Select an option below to begin
echo ------------------------------------------------------
echo c - Compile Server
echo r - Runserver
echo s - edit settins
echo ------------------------------------------------------
set /p select= Selection:
if %select%==c goto compile
if %select%==r goto run
if %select%==s goto settings
if %select%==C goto compile
if %select%==R goto run
if %select$==S goto settings
cls
pause

:compile
IF EXIST “%programfiles%\JAVA\JRE1.6.0_02\BIN” (goto compile4)

:compile4
cls
title Compiling…
echo Found: Java JRE 1.6.0_02
echo Compiling Server, Please Wait…
“C:\Program Files\Java\jre1.6.0_02\bin\java.exe” -cp . *.java
pause
cls
goto main

:run
cls
title Runserver
java -Xmx800M server
cls
pause

:settings
cls
echo Enter one of the following to change background colour…
echo —
echo B0 - Black
echo B1 - Blue
echo B2 = Green
echo B3 Cyan
echo B4 = Red
echo B5 = Purple
echo B6 = Yellow
echo B7 = White

echo Enter one of the following to change text colour…
echo —
echo T0 = Black
echo T1 = Blue
echo T2 = Green
echo T3 = Cyan
echo T4 = Red
echo T5 = Purple
echo T6 = Yellow
echo T7 = White

set /p s= selection:

if %s%== B0 (set b=0)
if %s%== B1 (set b=1)
if %s%== B2 (set b=2)
if %s%== B3 (set b=3)
if %s%== B4 (set b=4)
if %s%== B5 (set b=5)
if %s%== B6 (set b=6)
if %s%== B7 (set b=F)
if %s%== T0 (set t=0)
if %s%== T1 (set t=1)
if %s%== T2 (set t=2)
if %s%== T3 (set t=3)
if %s%== T4 (set t=4)
if %s%== T5 (set t=5)
if %s%== T6 (set t=6)
if %s%== T7 (set t=F)

color %b%%t%
pause
cls
goto main
[/code]

but this is what i get when i compile it

Found: Java JRE 1.6.0_02
Compiling Server, Please Wait…
Exception in thread “main” java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: antilag/java
Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: Server Setup (Please help!)
item.dc:creator: @Pilldom Pilldom
item.description:
@Pilldom wrote:

Its not that hard. Download one of these https://cds.sun.com/is-bin/INTERSHOP.enfinity/WFS/CDS-CDS_Developer-Site/en_US/-/USD/ViewProductDetail-Start?ProductRef=jdk-6u4-b-oth-JPR@CDS-CDS_Developer
Once youve downloaded that change the class paths and paths. Make sure that they have 0.4 instead of a earlier version like 0.2, which many tutorials have.

Read full topic

item.title: Server Setup (Please help!)
item.dc:creator: @Songoty Songoty
item.description:
@Songoty wrote:

Then just make it find the path instead of the varribles. For example, your compiler probally says

@echo off
title compiler
javac *.java
pause

Or something simmilar.
Replace javac
With

"C:\program files\java\jdk1.6.0_0X\bin\javac"

Of corse, in the area that says X put your update version of JDK

Read full topic
